definition: quarter (hour)/moment/to carve/to engrave/to cut/oppressive/classifier for short time intervals

sentences.english: Pricks his thin claw within some delicate nerve;
sentences.chinese: 以尖刻的爪子，刺痛敏感的神經。
她言語尖刻，有一張刀子般的嘴。

sentences.english: Her opinion is so harsh sometimes. It can be.
sentences.chinese: 我們也吵架，因爲她的意見有時很尖刻。

sentences.english: She often squelches others with biting sarcasm.
sentences.chinese: 她經常用尖刻的挖苦話壓服別人。

sentences.english: The movie has a keen, bitter sense of the sudden breakdown of preposterous illusions.
sentences.chinese: 電影犀利尖刻地反映了那些荒謬幻象的瞬間崩潰。

sentences.english: Mr Harris is as witty and cutting a writer as any.
sentences.chinese: 哈里斯先生的機智和尖刻不輸給任何作者。

sentences.english: Nice of you to turn up , " she said acidly ."
She squelched them with biting sarcasm.
sentences.chinese: 她用尖刻的挖苦話使人啞口無言。

sentences.english: His sharp-tongued criticism pulled me up thought.
sentences.chinese: 他尖刻的批評使我思考。

sentences.english: They will usually be the one with a crippling addiction and an acerbic sense of humor.
sentences.chinese: 他們常常會有嚴重的癖嗜和尖刻的幽默感。

sentences.english: That’s sort of a poignant irony.
sentences.chinese: 那段話有點尖刻的諷刺味。

sentences.english: They have prominent eyes, boldly cut wings and lobed undersides .
sentences.chinese: 他們有突出的眼睛，勇敢，翅膀和有葉的下面尖刻了。

sentences.english: Caustic remarks will hurt others' feelings.
His hostility to the woman found vent in a sharp remark.
sentences.chinese: 他用尖刻的話語發泄對那個女人的敵意。

sentences.english: Often developed sullen and acerbic character traits.
sentences.chinese: 經常暴露出鬱悶和尖刻的性格特徵。

sentences.english: Lincoln suggests Si Tan pauses, the letter that writes acrimonious of a content retaliates that fellow.
sentences.chinese: 林肯建議斯坦頓，寫一封內容尖刻的信回敬那傢伙。

definition: unkind/harsh/cutting/mean/acrimony/to embezzle by making illegal deductions
variant of 言辭|言辞[yan2 ci2]
to speak sarcastically/to make cutting remarks
to tease/to poke fun at/to make fun of
